title: PNG to WebP Converter - Free & Online | WikiHowTo.click
sub_title: Convert PNG images to WebP format online with transparency support, superior compression, and no watermarks.
hint: Upload your PNG image to start converting...
description:
Optimize your PNG to WebP for the modern web! Our free converter preserves transparency while delivering much smaller files. WebP combines PNG-style alpha with modern compression, making it ideal for logos, UI graphics, and images that need crisp edges.

In many cases, WebP is 30–50% smaller than PNG at similar visual quality and is supported by all major browsers. We auto-tune settings to balance fidelity and size for faster pages and lower bandwidth.

h1.title: Convert PNG to WebP Online
h1.description: Free and fast PNG to WebP converter with transparency support and superior compression. Works instantly on any device — no signup required.

h2.title: Why Convert PNG to WebP?
h2.description:
WebP is a modern replacement for heavy PNG assets:

  • Smaller Files: Commonly 30–50% smaller than PNG.
  • Transparency: Preserves alpha channel like PNG.
  • Performance: Faster page loads and lower bandwidth.
  • Compatibility: Supported by all major browsers.

h2.title: How to Convert PNG to WebP Online
h2.description:
1. Click Upload PNG and select your file.
  2. Wait for processing and optimization.
  3. Click Download WebP to save the result.

Defaults target web-friendly size/quality while keeping edges clean.

h2.title: WebP vs PNG Comparison
h2.description:
• File Size: WebP is typically 30–50% smaller.
  • Transparency: Both support alpha.
  • Quality: Similar perceived quality at lower bytes for WebP.
  • Compression: WebP uses more efficient codecs.

h2.title: Supported Limits & Formats
h2.description:
• Accepted input: PNG (image/png)
  • Maximum file size: up to 16 MB per file
  • Output: WebP (.webp, MIME image/webp)
  • Encoding: Lossy WebP, quality ≈ 90; transparency preserved

h2.title: Troubleshooting
h2.description:
• Older browsers: Serve WebP with a PNG fallback using the <picture> element.
  • Halos on edges: Start from higher-res PNG or refine alpha; WebP preserves transparency but jaggies may come from the source.
  • Still too large: Slightly lower quality (80–85%) or resize before converting.
  • Upload fails: Ensure PNG and ≤ 16 MB.

faq.question: Is this PNG to WebP converter free?
faq.answer: Yes, the converter is completely free with no hidden charges or subscriptions.

faq.question: Will WebP preserve transparency from PNG?
faq.answer: Yes. WebP fully supports alpha and preserves transparency from your PNG.

faq.question: How much smaller are WebP files compared to PNG?
faq.answer: Often 30–50% smaller at comparable visual quality, depending on the image.

faq.question: Will WebP work on all browsers?
faq.answer: WebP is supported by all modern browsers (Chrome, Firefox, Safari, Edge). Provide PNG fallback for very old browsers.

faq.question: What file sizes are supported?
faq.answer: You can upload images up to 16 MB per file.

faq.question: Can I convert multiple PNGs at once?
faq.answer: This page converts one file at a time. For bulk needs, repeat the process or use a batch tool.

note: For maximum compatibility, serve WebP with a PNG fallback using <picture>.
